description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on the Bailiwick of Guernsey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 1-4 September
title_page: Coronavirus: Guernsey updates and other news 1-4 September - BBC News
maintext:
Two senior committees in Sark have said contingency plans are in place if residents are cut off from the power grid.
Sark Electricity said it was being forced to remove power supplies from 19 properties after a local home-owner asked the company to remove cables from his land.
A joint statement from the Policy and Finance, and Medical and Emergency committees said a "robust contingency plan" was is in place if the households lost their power.
They say they're ready to implement their plan at short notice but hope an amicable agreement between landowner Sebastien Moerman and Sark Electricity can be worked out.
The Price Control Commissioner Anthony White, who investigates the price of electricity in Sark, said several residents had been in touch with him over the issue.
He described the situation as "unneccessary and avoidable" after he said Sark Electricity did not explore suggested solutions.
